page.title: 17What to do in Lydlinch
page.content:
The hub of social activity in the village is the{ Hooper Hall},so called because when it was erected in 1924 the then Rector,Rev.Samuel Fry Hooper provided the bulk of the funds while the village raised the rest and the Squire donated the land. The Hall is now administered by a committee of local people. Here are the events that take place regularily in the Hall. The{Women's Institute}meet once a month. Once a fortnight there is a{Whist {Drive}in aid of Church and Hall funds. Also once a fortnight the{Golden Age {Club}meet.This is for the over sixties.
The Hall is also used for Jumble sales,parties and the occasional Disco.
